description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1vto","text":"Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) is an essential technique for understanding the genetic composition of organisms. This protocol describes a cost-effective method for propagating phages from stock, extracting DNA, and preparing sequencing libraries. These libraries are then sequenced using the Illumina iSeq100. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7he8","text":"Digestion of Phage Protein","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6phue","text":"Normalization before library preparation ensures an equivalent representation of the sample amount for downstream reactions, reducing biases from sequencing depth and technical variations for accurate genomic analysis. The eluted phage DNA is serially diluted for accurate concentration measurement on Qubit (quantification). Based on the concentrations, the amount of DNA is normalized to have ~52 ng of DNA in 8.58 µL volume. The Qubit™ 1X dsDNA High Sensitivity (HS) and Broad Range (BR) Assay Kits do Quantification for double-stranded DNA (dsDNA). ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":505,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dokin","text":"Fragmentation and End Prep","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"128si","text":"Clean-up of Adapter-ligated DNA and Size Selection (0.9X wash)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebadl","text":"This step eliminates small untagged DNA fragments and short adapter sequences.  ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pe5d","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"q2tm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a0ch4","text":"Allow AMPure XP beads to sit at room temperature for 30 minutes before using the clean-up step, and vortex the beads vigorously to form a homogeneous mixture.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ct46","text":"Prepare a Co-Culture by adding 50 µL phage volume from targeted dilution to 200 µL Salmonella Typhi BRD948 overnight liquid culture. Incubate for 20 minutes at room temperature for host-phage attachment.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":83,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":99,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"874te","text":"Add the Co-Culture (250 µL) into a 4 mL soft TSA tube (molten and equilibrated at 56°C - 60°C) and pour on a TSA plate (1.5% agar). Incubate the plates at 37°C for 16-18 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak9ub","text":"Prepare enzyme mix containing 50 µL DNA Digestion Buffer, 1 µL DNase I (1U/µL), and 0.5 µL RNase A (20mg/mL). Add the enzyme mix to 450 µL propagated phage from step 2.5. Incubate at 37°C for 1.5 hours. Do not shake or vortex.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":161,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":203,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4rkr","text":"After incubation, add 20 µL 0.5 M EDTA (final concentration 20 mM) to deactivate the enzymes. Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.​ ","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3r66g","text":"Add 1.25 µL Proteinase K (20 mg/mL). Incubate at 56°C for 1.5 hours. Do not shake or vortex.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"421iq","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7idmk","text":"This is \"Phage Lysate\".","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h87","text":"","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tjei","text":"Bring the reagents and buffer to room temperature 30 minutes before the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mtkb","text":"Prepare working solutions (reagents and buffer mix) for both standards and eluted phage DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ib9g","text":"The final volume in each tube must be 100 µL. For each standard, 95 µL of the working solution is required while 99 µL is required for each DNA sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag1do","text":"For Standards, take 95 µL of the working solution in 2 tubes. Add 5 µL of each Qubit standard to appropriate tubes, vortex, and spin them shortly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e53am","text":"For samples, take 99 µL of the working solution in N tubes (N is the number of phage samples). Add 1 µL of 100-fold diluted DNA to appropriate working solution tubes; vortex, and spin them shortly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":60,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9urjh","text":"Incubate the tubes in the dark for 2 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ekb","text":"Measure the standards and samples in the Qubit Fluorometer under the High Sensitivity Range ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jj3k","text":"Calculate the concentration of 10-fold diluted samples and/or 1-fold tubes from the Qubit results. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cnd5","text":"Repeat the quantification step (step 7.5) with 10-fold diluted tubes if the results for 100-fold diluted tubes read “Too Low.” ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12aii","text":"Calculate the volume of DNA and nuclease-free water required to make a solution of 52 ng of DNA in 8.58 µL volume. Select the volume and dilution factors that can be used for normalization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8chc","text":"Aliquot 10.23 µL of the Adapter ligation master mix directly to the Fragmentation reaction mixture from step 8.2 (11.55 µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2tb53","text":"Add 0.825 µL adapter separately to avoid the formation of adapter dimers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ioou","text":"Total: 22.6 µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eo0as","text":"Briefly vortex and spin the reaction mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6adf8","text":"Incubate at 20°C for 15 minutes in a thermocycler with the heated LID OFF. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8ogrm","text":"Prepare 80% EtOH. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1caa5","text":"Use 0.9x ratio of beads - to - total volume of sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34lqe","text":"Add 20.34 µL of AMPure XP beads (0.9x) to Adaptor Ligated products. Mix well by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fjtqg","text":"Incubate for 5 miutesn at room temperature.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d42j","text":"Place samples on a magnetic rack and incubate for 5 minutes on the rack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8dgq1","text":"Carefully remove the supernatant, without disturbing the beads.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f1o8","text":"Add 200 µL of 80% Ethanol to each sample in the magnetic rack. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds then remove Ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5uh1","text":"Repeat step 10.7 once more and carefully remove any residual ethanol with a 10 µL pipette tip.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7t85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6dc5","text":"Air dry the beads for 5 - 10 minutes while the tubes are on the magnetic rack with cap open.   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qpai","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8roav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"30aub","text":"**Caution:","type":"align-left"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d1ujd","text":"Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. ","type":"align-left"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1inl5","text":"When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.  ","type":"align-left"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qdkl","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack. Add 6.95 µL of nuclease-free water. {"blocks":[{"key":"c8mip","text":"Following the Double-Layer Agar (DLA) method, add 200 µL of overnight grown Salmonella Typhi BRD948 culture to the 4 mL molten TSA tube and pour it on a TSA plate (1.5% agar). Let the plate solidify for 30 - 60 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":92,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5m174","text":"Phage gDNA purification","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8b63d","text":"Add 200 µL AL buffer to 200 µL of the Phage Lysate from step 4.1 and vortex the mixture. Incubate the mixture at 70​°C for 10 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cpj3","text":"Let the tube cool to room temperature, add 200 µL ice-cold ethanol (99%), and vortex the mixture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"es925","text":"Transfer the mixture into the spin column, and centrifuge at 8000 rcf for 1 minute.​ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6vd7","text":"Discard the filtrate, add 500 µL AW1 buffer into the spin column, and centrifuge at 8000 rcf for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d8u8","text":"Discard the filtrate, add 500 µL AW2 buffer into the spin column, and centrifuge at 14000 rcf for 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"vpil","text":"Discard the filtrate and centrifuge for 1 minute at 14000 rpm to avoid carryover.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh499","text":"Transfer the spin column to a microcentrifuge tube and add 30 µL AE buffer. Incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature and centrifuge for 2 minutes at 8000 rcf to elute the DNA.​ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v91j","text":"Add the eluted volume into the spin column again, and centrifuge for 2 minutes at 8000 rcf to elute a higher concentration of phage DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5g3qv","text":"Measure the DNA concentration using Qubit Fluorometer or Nanodrop (described below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7n4","text":"Analyze the DNA using 0.8% agarose gel by loading 5 µL DNA sample to check the quality of the extracted genomic DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vupe","text":"The eluted phage DNA can be stored at -20°C until library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91a6g","text":"Purification of Propagated Phages","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al05f","text":"Upon observation of the \"webbed\" confluent lysed plate, pour 4 mL of chilled LB (4°C) over the plate followed by incubation at 4°C for 4 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":143}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5f6pb","text":"Dislodge the top agar (using a sterile glass scrapper or a bent tip) and transfer 2 mL of the mixture into a new microcentrifuge tube using a pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":151}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t13a","text":"Add 4 drops of chloroform, vortex for 20 seconds, and rest for 10 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jumt","text":"Centrifuge at 10000 rcf for 10 minutes at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6igmj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1toaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25qc5","text":"Transfer 1 - 1.5 mL supernatant into a fresh microcentrifuge tube without disturbing the pellet. Label the tube and keep it at 4°C for downstream experiments. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"align-justify","offset":0,"length":97}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nu8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0tbo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":56,"offset":0,"style":"align-justify"}],"key":"d0n2s","text":"The supernatant contains active phage and bacterial DNA.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
